It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. Due to its limited habitat and specific environmental requirements, Oreogrammitis kjellbergii is considered a sensitive indicator species for assessing the health of its ecosystem.
